Ownership: China Molybdenum Company Limited/Contemporary Amperex Technology Co., Limited (CATL)/Gécamines
Geographical description & project descr: KFM is located in the Bayeke chiefdom, Lubudi territory, Lualaba province, in southern DR. Congo, the project is about 55 km east of the town of Kolwezi and 25 km west of the city of Tenke, and about 33 km southwest of the existing TFM copper and cobalt mine. Several mining companies operate in the vicinity of PE 815. The two closest mines are KISANFU Mining and Minière de KALUMBWE-MYUNGA .
Deposit size (official reserves):
Mineral resources estimated according to the geological model built by NERIN in 2021 are 198.8 million tonnes.
- Copper content is 2.13%, containing approximately 4.23 million tonnes of copper metal
- Cobalt content is 1.01%, containing approximately 1.999 million tonnes of cobalt metal
Project background:
A company incorporated under Congolese law on January 23, 2021, KFM is a subsidiary of China Molybdenum Company Ltd ("CMOC"), which has held the mining permit ( PE 815) since December 13, 2020, following the indirect transfer of mining assets of the KISANFU project held by PHELPS DOGDE CONGO SARL to China Molybdenum Company Ltd (CMOC). In 2021, CATL acquired a 25% stake in Kisanfu Holding, thereby acquiring 71.25% of the Kisanfu Mine project.

Geographical description & project descr: SOMIDEZ is located in Mutshatsha Territory, Luilu sector, Mwanfwe customary group, 35 kilometers from the town of Kolwezi. It is surrounded by the Lualaba River and Lake Kando. It borders the Mutanda Mining company. The concession is well fenced off to prevent incursions by illegal artisanal miners.
Deposit size (official reserves): SOMIDEZ has estimated reserves of 4600,000 tonnes of copper and 420,000 tonnes of cobalt.
Project background: En decembre 2005, la Gécamines et Platmin congo Limited ont signé le contrat relatif à la prospection sur les polygones de Deziwa et de l'Ecaille C.                                                                                                                                                                                                             En decembre 2007, signature du contrat  d'option pour garantir et proteger le droit de Platmin Congo                                                                                                                                                                                                                               En aout 2008,   signature de la convention de joint venture entre Gécamines et Platmin Congo créant la Société Minière de deziwa et ecaille C SPRL en abrégé SOMIDEC SPRL.                                                                                                           En septebre 2012 la Gécamines possede la totalité de part de Smidec.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          En janvier 2016, accord cadre de partenariat entre la Gécamines et Group China Nonferrous Metal Mining créant Somidez.

Geographical description & project descr: The mining concessions are located in the Lubudi territory, Lualaba Province in the Democratic Republic of Congo, more or less 100.6 km from the mining town of Kolwezi. The TFM mining concession covers an area of around 1,600 square kilometers.
Deposit size (official reserves): Cobalt mineral reserves estimated at around 103 million tonnes, with average grades of 2.09% cobalt.
Project background: En 1997: LUNDIN HOLDING LTD,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     En 2004, LUNDIN HOLDINGS LTD fait appel à BROKEN HILL PROPRIETARY LTD (BHP) et le géant minier américain PHELPS DODGE CORPORATION,                                                                                                                                         En 2007, Freeport McMoRan sՎtait substitué à PHELPS DODGE CORPORATION dans le partenariat TFM. Que donc à partir de l'année 2007,  la structure actionnariale de l'entreprise comprenait  Freeport McMoRan  à 56 %, Lundin Holdings à 24 % et Gécamines à 20 %,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     En 2018, China Molybdenum Co Ltd, rachéte les parts de la Société Lundin Holding et devient l'actionnaire principal avec 80 % de parts et la Gécamines y conserve quant à elle 20 % de parts.

Deposit size (official reserves):
Kalongwe contains near-surface JORC resources of 30,000 t of contained copper (grade 3.03% Cu) and 42,700 t of contained cobalt (grade 0.36% Co) in mainly oxidized ore.  Kalongwe currently has an ore reserve of 6.98 million tonnes grading 3.03% Cu and 0.36% Co, i.e. 211994 tonnes of contained Cu and 25128 tonnes of contained Co.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Kalongwe dispose actuellement d'une réserve de minerai de 6,98 millions de tonnes à 3,03 % de Cu et 0,36 % de Co, soit 211994 tonnes de Cu contenu et 25128 tonnes de Co contenu.
Project background: Projet acquis de l'autralien Nzuri Copper en 2020 par Xuchen International Co., filiale de Chengtun Mining

Project name: COMMUS (Compagnie Minière de Musonoie Global SAS)
Geographical description & project descr: The company's head office is located in Pierre Muteba, groupement Kazembe, secteur Luilu, and another part of the concession is in downtown Kolwezi, more precisely in the commune of Dilala between the Kanina and Musonoie districts.
Deposit size (official reserves): Reserves are estimated at 1.08 million tonnes of copper grading 4.17% and 130,000 tonnes of cobalt grading 0.12%.
Share allocation: Zijin Mining 72%, Gécamines 28%.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          NB:  dans le cahier des charges des responsabilités sociétal de l'entreprise, il est mentionné que: Zijin Mining Group Company Limited détient 72% et la Génerale des carrières et des Mines (Gécamines) détient 28%
Project background: En decembre 2005, la Gécamines signe avec Hhina National Overseas Engineering Corporation en sigle COVEC le contrat de creation la Société dénommée: la Compagnie Minière de Musonoie Global en abrégé COMMUS.

Project name: COMMUS (Compagnie Minière de Musonoie Global SAS)
Deposit size (official reserves): Reserves are estimated at 1.08 million tonnes of copper grading 4.17% and 130,000 tonnes of cobalt grading 0.12%.
Share allocation: Zijin Mining 72%, Gécamines 28%.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          NB:  dans le cahier des charges des responsabilités sociétal de l'entreprise, il est mentionné que: Zijin Mining Group Company Limited détient 72% et la Génerale des carrières et des Mines (Gécamines) détient 28%

Ownership: Shengtun Mining  et le gouvernement congolais
Copper/Cobalt annual production (2022): Kalongwe n'a pas encore commencé la production
Geographical description & project descr: Kalongwe Mining is located in the Kalongo village in the Musokatanda traditional community, Lufupa sector, Mutshatsha territory, 45 km from the town of Kolwezi and around 15 km from the Kamoa company.
Deposit size (official reserves): The project has an ore reserve estimate of 6.98 million tonnes at 3.03% copper and 0.36% cobalt, or 211,494 tonnes of contained copper and 25,128 tonnes of contained cobalt.
Mine life/permit validity: 30 ans renouvable une fois pour 15 ans.
Share allocation: Selon les informations recueillies auprès de la division de mines de la province du Lualaba, l'entreprise Kalongwe serait détenu indirectement par Chengtun Mining à 95% et le gouvernement congolais
Project background: En juin 2005 acquisition de Kalongwe Mining par Regal Resources Lited.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            En novembre 2013 aquisition d'une participation de 30% dans le projet de civre cobalt de kolongwe et la Société internationale de négoce de matières premières Traxys Europe, SA (30%) et La Générale Industrielle et Commerciale au Congo SPRL (40%).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   En janvier 2017, changement de raison sociale de la Société pour devenir  NZURI COPPER LIMITER ( autralien).                                                                                                                                                                                                                En fevrier 2019 , conclusion pa Nzuri d'un concordat avec Chengtun Mining.

Ownership: Sinohydro, China Railway Group Limited, et Gécamines
Geographical description & project descr: Sicomines is located between the commune of Dilala, city of Kolwezi, and the village of Mutaka, gropement Kazembe, Luilu sector, Mutshatsha territory, about 5 km from the city of Kolwezi.
Deposit size (official reserves): Ore reserves are estimated at 250 million tonnes, with copper at 3.22% and cobalt at 0.192%.
Project background: En  Avril 2008,  la  joint venture a été créée sous la dénomination de SICOMINES, adoptant la forme d'une SARL,                                                                                                                                                                                                                    En Avril 210, une étude de faisabilité était réalisée par le cabinet chinois CHINA ENFI, les reserves Minières ont été évaluées à 8544900 tonnes de cuivre et 571 800 tonnes de cobalt.                                                                        En 2014, la Sicomines Sarl et transformée en Société anonyme à la suite de l'application des normes OHADA par la RD Congo.                                                                                                                                                                                      En 2015 la mine a été achevée d'etre construite et la Société est entrée en production en octobre 2015; et 2016 a été sa première année de pleine production.
Management: Directeur Géneral: Li SHENG Directeur général

Geographical description & project descr: Lamikal is a mining company located about 64 km east of the town of Kolwezi, on national road no. 39, about 110 km northwest of the town of Likasi, and about 230 km from the city of Lubumbashi. The site is located in the village of Pumpi, in the Nguba groupement, Bayeke chiefdom, Lubudi territory, Lualabe province, DR Congo.
Project background: En mars 2001, contrat de creation de Société d'exploitation des Gisement de Kalukundi en abregé "SWANMINES sprl" entre la Gécamines et  l'entreprise H e J Swanepoel famille trust.                                                                                                   EN 2017, etudes de faisabilité.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       En 2020, les premières cathodes de cuivre et cobalt ont été sorties

Project name: MKM SAS (la Minière de Kalumbwe Myunga)
Geographical description & project descr: The company's licence is located in Kalumbwe Myunga village, Groupement de Nguba, Chefferie de Bayeke, Territoire de Lubudi, Province of Lualaba, DR Congo. About 55 km east of the town of Kolwezi, about 168 km northwest of the town of Likasi and about 288 km from the city of Lubumbashi. Several mining companies operate in the vicinity of PE 674. The three nearest mines are KISANFU Mining CMOC, Kisanfu Mining KIMIN and Mutanda Mining.
Deposit size (official reserves): Les réserves géologiques du bien sont estimées 100 000 tonnes cuivre
Share allocation: China Railway Resources Co, LTD 80, Gécamines 18%
Project background: La Génerale et la Société dénommée EXPLOITATIONS ARTISANALES AU CONGO «EXACO» ont signé en date du 31 mars 1998 un contrat d 'association pour l exploitation Minière artisanale des gisements de Luita Breches, Kinservere et Karavia, en vue de la production de cuivre et de cobalt ainsi que d autres substances minérales de valeur commerciale. Les deux parties ont convenu de remplacer les gisements de Luita breches et Karavia sus évoqués par les gisements de Kalumbwe et Myunga. C'est dans ce cadre qu elles se sont accordées à poursuivre leur collaboration dans une Société privée à Responsabilité Limitée pour exploiter ces nouveaux gisements et ont signé en date du 20 juillet 2001 le contrat de création de la Société MKM Sprl                                                                                                                                                                                                                             En juillet 2001, signature de contrat de Société relatif à l'exploitation des gisments de kalumbwe et de Myunga en abregé MKM Sprlentre la G&camines et EXACO Sprl.                                                                                                             En décembre 2005, la Gécamines a cédé 27,5% du capital social à CHINA NATIONAL OVERSEAS ENGENEERRING CORPORATION en abregé COVEC et n'ayant gardée que 17,5% capital social de MKM Sprl et EXACO  Sprl a cédé 43,5% du capital social à COVEC n'ayant gardée que 11,5% du capital social de MKM.                                                                                                                                                                                                                           En mars 2008,  la Gécamines a cédé la totalité de ses Parts sociales soit 17,5% à Monsieur SUKADI DIABOD et que COVEC a cédé la totalité de ses Parts sociales de MKM Sprl à China Railway Group Limited en abrégé "CRG LTD"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   En decembre 2008,  CRG LTD a cédé la tolité de ses Part sociales de MKM Sprl au prpfit de Hhina Railway Resources Co, LTD,  "CRR LTD"  Société d' Etat de droit chinois

Geographical description & project descr: The company luilu ressource is located in the village NOA Groupement de Mwilu, secteur Luilu, Territoire de Mutshatsha, Province du lualaba, in DR Congo, at least 3.5 km from the town of Kolwezi. Under the R39 national road.
Mine life/permit validity: Contrat en viguer jusquՈ l'épuisement économique des réserves de cuivre.

Geographical description & project descr: The company is located near the village of Kisanfu Groupement de Nguba, Chefferie de Bayeke, Territoire de Lubudi, Province of Lualaba, DR Congo, 55 km east of the town of Kolwezi. Several mining companies operate on the same area: MKM, KFM CMOC and Mutanda Mining.

Ownership: Ivanhoe Mines Ltd/ Zijin co Ltd/Gouvernement de la RD Congo/Crystal River Global Limited
Geographical description & project descr: The KAMOA KAKULA project is located in the province of Lualaba, Mutshatsha territory, Luilu and Lufupa sectors, in the Mwilu and Musokatanda groupemen respectively, and in areas under the traditional authority of the Mpala and Muvunda chiefs of land in south-eastern DRC, 25 km west of the town of Kolwezi and around 270 km west of the city of Lubumbashi.
Deposit size (official reserves): The property's geological reserves are estimated at 100,000 tonnes of copper.
Share allocation: Ivanhoe Mines Ltd:39,6 % , Zijin co Ltd: 39,6% , Gouvernement de la RD Congo: 20% ,Crystal River Global Limited: 0,8% . * Note : Dans son son rapport annuel de 2022, Zijin affirme détenir 45% des parts dans le projet.

Ownership: Ivanhoe Mines Ltd/ Zijin co Ltd/Gouvernement de la RD Congo/Crystal River Global Limited
Ivanhoe Mines Ltd/ Zijin co Ltd/Gouvernement de la RD Congo/Crystal River Global Limited
CHIRAZ VIRJI/FAZIL ABRAS VIRJI/SHALINA RESSOURCES Ltd
Geographical description & project descr: The Mutoshi project is located within the boundaries of permits PE2604 (held by Gécamines but leased to Chemaf) and PE2756 (held by Chemaf). Both are "Permis d'Exploitation". Chemaf has obtained a 25-year lease for PE2604, which gives it the right to mine and process ore from the concession. In exchange for these rights, Chemaf had to pay Gécamines US$52.5 million over 3 years (paid) and must also pay a 2% royalty (on gross revenues) to Gécamines.
Deposit size (official reserves): Reserves at the Mutoshi North and North-East deposits contain 276,022 tonnes of copper and 122,960 tonnes of cobalt; the mine life at Mutoshi is 6 years, with processing taking around 9 years based on current reserves; Chemaf has a resource and reserve development plan to extend the mine life to over 25 years.

Copper/Cobalt annual production (2022): 33,521.78 tonnes Cu/  9,563.79 tonnes Co (14700 tonnes Co according to Glencore's 2022 annual report)
Geographical description & project descr: The Mutanda Ming project is located in the Mwanfwe customary grouping, Luilu sector, Mutshastsha territory, in the Lualaba province of DR Congo, more or less 43 km from the town of Kolwezi, the provincial capital, and 440 km from the border town of Kasumbalesa, the only main route for mineral evacuation.                                                                                                                          The Mutanda mining site borders on Kisanfu Mining, Somidez and Kimin. The Chabara artisanal mine is located here.
Deposit size (official reserves): Proven and probable reserves at the Mutanda North mine in December 2022 were estimated at 18.9Mt, grading 1.00% copper and 0.52% cobalt.
Project background: En novembre 2000 signature d'un protocole d'accord preliminaire de création d'une Société privée à responsabilité limité ( Sprl) entre Gécamines et la Société Southern African Metal Refiners Congo Sprl (SAMREF) une entreprise privée de droit congolais.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Par la suite, les deux entreprises ont signé le 16 mai 2001 le contrat de creation n°474/10300/SG/DG/2001 sur base duquel les premiers statuts de Mtanda Mining ont été élaborés en date du 9 avril 2002.                                                        En date du 1er mars 2011, vend la totalité des ses parts à ROWNY ASSETS Limited.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              En date du 25 juillet 2013, il y a eu la fusion-absorption entre Mutanda Mining et  Kansuki Mining et le PE N°643 de Kasunki a été transféré à Mutanda Mining.                                                                                                                                                                                                      Enfin , le 18 fevrier 2015, Mutanda Mining a acquis le droit sur le Permis d'exploitation n°658 du gisement de Chabara.

Project name: METALKOL (La Compagnie de traitement des Rejets de Kingamyambo)
Geographical description & project descr: Metalkol Roan Tailings Reclamation (RTR) in the Kolwezi region of the DRC consists of two former tailings deposits containing around 110 million tonnes of reserves (2019). In 2020, Metalkol reached full production capacity of phase 1 and completed construction of phase 2, with the additional plant ramping up production.
Deposit size (official reserves): Two former tailings deposits containing around 110 million tonnes of reserves (2019)

Geographical description & project descr: The Comide project is a combination of the Africo and Comide deposits. Commissioned in 2012, it is an open-pit mining operation with a hydrometallurgy plant.
Located in the Mutshatsha territory of Lualaba province, Ruashi Mining's permit is adjacent to the south of Glencore's Kamoto Copper Mining permit 4960.

Project size: Metorex Limited's Ruashi mine is located five kilometers east of Lubumbashi, the second largest city in the Democratic Republic of Congo. It comprises an open-pit mine and a hydrometallurgical plant. The mine has an annual production capacity of 36,000 tonnes of copper cathode and 5,300 tonnes of cobalt metal in its cobalt hydroxide products.
Deposit size (official reserves): 5 mining squares / 424.75 ha

Project size: Metorex Limited's Ruashi mine is located five kilometers east of Lubumbashi, the second largest city in the Democratic Republic of Congo. It comprises an open-pit mine and a hydrometallurgical plant. The mine has an annual production capacity of 36,000 tonnes of copper cathode and 5,300 tonnes of cobalt metal in its cobalt hydroxide products.
Deposit size (official reserves): 8 mining squares /679.64 ha

Geographical description & project descr:
Located on the border between the DRC and Zambia, 30 km north of Ndola, the Frontier mine is the cornerstone of ERGA's copper activities. It benefits from access to stable infrastructure in terms of road, rail and power networks.
The Frontier mine comprises an open-pit copper mine and processing facilities to produce copper sulfide concentrates. The open-pit processing facilities are capable of processing over 10 million tonnes of copper sulfide ore per year, producing around 350 kt of concentrate. In 2019, it produced 84,254 tonnes of copper contained in concentrate.
Deposit size (official reserves): The permit contains estimated reserves of 51.8 Mt grading 0.98% copper.

Geographical description & project descr:
Compagnie Minière de Luisha (COMILU) is a joint venture between China National Overseas Engineering Corporation (COVEC), a subsidiary of China Railway, and Gécamines, a state-owned mining company in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC). COMILU was created in 2006 to exploit the Luisha copper and cobalt deposit, one of the largest in the DRC. In 2009, the two parties signed an amendment under which COVEC sold its 72% stake to China Railway and Gecamines sold its 28% stake to Mr. Zongwe Kiluba.
The Luisha deposit is located in the Katanga province of the DRC, around 100 kilometers from the city of Lubumbashi.
Deposit size (official reserves): 26.1 million tonnes of ore at an average grade of 2.95% copper and 0.68% cobalt
Mine life/permit validity: Licence valid until 03/04/2024. But the partnership is for 25 years

Geographical description & project descr:
Compagnie Minière de Luisha (COMILU) is a joint venture between China National Overseas Engineering Corporation (COVEC), a subsidiary of China Railway, and Gécamines, a state-owned mining company in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC). COMILU was created in 2006 to exploit the Luisha copper and cobalt deposit, one of the largest in the DRC. In 2009, the two parties signed an amendment under which COVEC sold its 72% stake to China Railway and Gecamines sold its 28% stake to Mr. Zongwe Kiluba.
The Luisha deposit is located in the Katanga province of the DRC, around 100 kilometers from the city of Lubumbashi.
The permit is located in the Basanga chiefdom, Kambove territory, 20 km northwest of the town of Likasi, Haut-Katanga province.
Mine life/permit validity: Licence valid until 4/10/2043. The partnership runs until reserves are exhausted.

Geographical description & project descr: Kinsenda Mine is located in the Democratic Republic of Congo, near the border town of Kasumbalesa.
Deposit size (official reserves): Reported mineral resources amount to 20.7 million tonnes at a grade of 5.6% copper.

Geographical description & project descr: Copper is extracted from an open-pit mine, as ground conditions allow most areas to be mined without blasting. After mill and mill treatment, acid leaching, solvent extraction and electrowinning are used to plate the copper.

Project name: Société d'exploitation de Kipoi/ SEK (Kipoi Mines)
Geographical description & project descr: The Kipoi mining permit is located 75 km northwest of Lubumbashi, the capital of Katanga province, in the central part of the Katanga copper belt.
Deposit size (official reserves): As of December 2014, mineral resources at the Kipoi copper project stood at 938,000 tonnes of copper.

Project name: Société d'exploitation de Kipoi/ SEK (Kipoi Mines)
Geographical description & project descr:
The Kipoi copper project is operated by SEK (Société d'Exploitation de Kipoi), a 95%-owned subsidiary of Tiger. It is located 75 km northwest of Lubumbashi, the capital of Katanga province, in the central part of the Katanga copper belt.
The Kipoi mining permit covers an area of 55 km2 and contains a 12 km-long segment (scale) extensively mineralized with copper and cobalt in Upper Roan sediments (R2, R4). The project hosts five known copper deposits: Kipoi Central, Kipoi North, Kileba, Judeira and Kaminafitwe.
Deposit size (official reserves): According to Tiger Ressources' 2019 annual report, as at June 30, 2019 stood at 43.3 Mt grading 1.12% copper and 0.06% cobalt, or 485 Kt copper and 24 Kt cobalt.

Geographical description & project descr: The Shituru copper mine is located in Katanga province, in the southeast of the DRC, around 2 kilometers from the town of Likas and 125 kilometers west of Lubumbashi, the capital of Katanga province.
Deposit size (official reserves): Metal reserves stand at 3.89 million tonnes, with an average copper content of 4.7%.

Project name: SOMIKA (Société de Développement Industriel et Minier du Katanga)

Geographical description & project descr: ND
The project covers the development of the Kipese Sud I, II, V and VII deposits in the Kipese territory in the Kambove territory, a few kilometers from Likasi.
Deposit size (official reserves): The farm-in agreement signed between the two parties in 2021 referred to the identification of probable geological resources estimated at 29,387,799 ts at 1.77% Cu, or 520,442 Tcup.

Geographical description & project descr: Lualaba Copper Smelter started out as a copper and cobalt processing entity. In 2017, it acquired mining license 14044 in the Mutshatsha territory of Lualaba province. The permit is valid for 30 years, until 2047, and covers copper, cassiterite, cobalt, tin and manganese ores.
Share allocation: China Nonferrous Metal Mining (CNMC) (60%), Yunan Copper Mining (40%)
